newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rubber stable in noon trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rubber stable in noon trading.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 rubber prices were generally stable in noon trading on Tuesday, with the focus on Thailand where much cheaper prices prevailed, traders said.

"We heard Thai sellers have sold rubber at 47.25 U.S. cents/lb, which is below Indonesian prices. This makes local traders a little bit nervous because buyer attention is on Thailand," said one trader.
"Supply is quite abundant in Thailand and traders there want to get rid of the stocks as quickly as they can," said the trader.
Traders said Singaporean dealers bought rubber overnight at 47.50 cents/lb fob Palembang for August shipment and that a deal was also done at the same price in Medan.
They said offer prices were quoted at 48.25 fob Medan, 48.00 fob Surabaya, 47.625 fob Padang, and 47.25 fob Pontianak and Jambi.
"We can sell rubber at prices below Thailand's level, but since supply is tight in the local market, I don't think it is profitable to lower the offer prices," said another trader.
"In most cases, tight supply will lead to higher offer prices," he said.
Regional traders have said soft consumer demand and rising production will probably drag Southeast Asian rubber prices lower this week, after a recent bout of modest shortcovering.
